title: Kranti Goud: Daughter of a MP police constable, who rocked England with 6/52
content: Kranti Goud, a 21-year-old pace sensation from a small village in Madhya Pradesh, delivered a match-winning performance for India, claiming 6 for 52 against England. Her journey from humble beginnings, supported by her coach Rajiv Bilthare and later Chandrakant Pandit, culminated in a series-clinching victory.

title: ED files case against Myntra over Rs 1,654 crore FDI violation; company responds
content: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a complaint under Fema against Myntra, its entities, and directors for alleged FDI violations worth Rs 1,654.35 crore, accusing the company of misusing the wholesale trade route for multi-brand retail. Myntra, a Walmart unit, responded saying it has not received the complaint or documents and remains committed to cooperating with authorities.

title: ‘The only right answer is…’: Bill Gates on daughter’s unexpected ask
content: Bill Gates, the Microsoft co-founder, recently took on a customer service role at Phia, his daughter Phoebe's AI-powered fashion startup. Phoebe and her co-founder Sophia Kianni developed Phia, a platform that helps users compare prices across numerous online retailers. Gates emphasized the importance of directly engaging with users to understand a product's functionality and potential issues.

title: IND vs ENG: Shocking! England’s tailenders have more runs than India’s top 4
content: Ahead of the Manchester Test, a surprising statistic reveals England's lower-order batsmen—Liam Dawson, Chris Woakes, Brydon Carse, and Jofra Archer—possess more combined first-class runs than India's top four. This highlights England's batting depth, contrasting with India's less experienced top order. As England leads the series 2-1, their strong lower order could be pivotal.

title: Rajya Sabha to hold discussion on Pahalgam attack on Tuesday; 16-hour session planned
content: Rajya Sabha will hold a 16-hour discussion on the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor next Tuesday. This follows two days of disruptions due to Opposition protests. Opposition MPs demanded an immediate debate, leading to multiple adjournments. The House faced repeated disruptions as members insisted on addressing the SIR issue first. Several notices for discussions were rejected, adding to the tension.

title: Infosys Q1 results: IT giant posts net profit of Rs 6,921 crore, up 9% YoY
content: Infosys reported a 9% YoY increase in consolidated net profit, reaching Rs 6,921 crore for Q1, with revenue up 8% to Rs 42,279 crore. The company has revised its revenue growth guidance upward, projecting 1-3% growth in constant currency for FY26. Despite a slight dip in operating margin, Infosys secured significant deals and maintained strong cash flow.

title: 'No phones or laptops': BlackRock’s strict travel rule for staff; tech in China trips
content: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has restricted employee device usage in China due to rising US-China tensions. Staff must now use temporary phones and cannot use company laptops. This policy enhancement, effective July 16, reflects growing corporate anxiety after incidents involving Western executives being prevented from leaving China.

title: IND vs ENG : Kamboj turns ailing father's faith into India Test cap: 'Beta tappa...'
content: Anshul Kamboj has taken a long road to live his ultimate dream, playing Test cricket for India. The 24-year-old was one of the favourites to be picked for the England tour but narrowly missed out. Last week, he was drafted into the Indian squad for the fourth Test against England in Manchester after injuries to all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy and the pace duo of Akash Deep and Arshdeep Singh. Now, he is set to make his Test debut at Old Trafford.

title: ‘Hurts Islamic sentiments’: BJP slams Dimple Yadav’s attire at mosque; Akhilesh fires back
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav for conducting a party meeting inside a mosque on Parliament Street, alleging that Dimple Yadav's attire violated mosque norms and hurt Islamic sentiments. Dimple Yadav refuted the claims, accusing the BJP of misleading the public, while Akhilesh Yadav slammed the BJP for using religion as a divisive tool.

title: Who is Bryan Johnson: Anti-aging champion who spent $2 million on age-reversing
content: Bryan Johnson, the tech entrepreneur known for his anti-aging pursuits, is discontinuing his age-reversal startup, Blueprint, citing financial losses and a desire to concentrate on his philosophical movement, "Don't Die." Johnson, famous for his intense health regimen, aims to fully dedicate himself to this new mission, viewing commercial ventures as distractions from his goal of reshaping humanity's relationship with death.

title: Dhankhar Dhamaka: Election for VP must be held ‘ASAP’ in event of a vacancy
content: The election to the vice-president's office must occur promptly upon a vacancy, or before the incumbent's term expires. The electoral college, comprising Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members, elects the vice-president through proportional representation using a single transferable vote. The Election Commission oversees the process, with MPs voting by secret ballot and political parties unable to issue whips.

title: 'Friends' star Matthew Perry's doctor to plead guilty
content: Dr. Salvador Palensia, Matthew Perry's doctor, is expected to plead guilty to illegally providing Ketamine to the actor before his fatal overdose in 2023. He will admit guilt on four counts of Ketamine distribution, with other charges dropped. Palensia's attorneys claim he wasn't treating Perry at the time of death, nor did he provide the lethal dose.

title: Air India crash: British victims' families receive wrong bodies
content: Families of British victims from the Air India crash are facing further anguish as some received misidentified remains. Errors came to light during DNA verification, leading to cancelled funerals and the discovery of "commingled" remains. Authorities are urged to provide explanations for the distress caused by these mistakes, which compound the tragedy of the fatal crash.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ box office collection day 6: Mohit Suri's film inches towards Rs 150 crore club
content: Mohit Suri's directorial 'Saiyaara,' starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has become an unexpected box office success. The film recorded the highest opening day for newcomers and continued its strong performance, earning Rs 83 crore in its first weekend, a record for a love story.

title: IND vs ENG Test: Gill loses another toss, India's wait gets longer
content: India's coin toss woes continued as Shubman Gill lost his fourth consecutive toss, marking 14 straight losses across formats since January. Despite this, Gill remained optimistic, citing favourable batting conditions and highlighting India's strong performance in previous Tests. England chose to bowl after winning the toss. Debutant Anshul Kamboj joined Anil Kumble in a rare red-ball feat.

title: Landslide in Rajasthan village: Hill breaks apart with explosion-like roar
content: A significant landslide struck near Nari village in Rajasthan's Chirawa region early Wednesday, following the collapse of a hill section. Villagers attribute the incident to alleged illegal blasting by mining contractors, exacerbated by recent heavy rainfall. While no casualties were reported, the event triggered panic and claims of structural damage to a nearby school.

title: Russia oil sanctions hit: Traders, shippers avoid Nayara Energy India
content: Global shipping firms and petroleum traders are reportedly avoiding Nayara Energy, an Indian refiner, following recent EU sanctions linked to its significant stakeholder, Rosneft. Several vessels, including the Talara and Chang Hang Xing Yun, have altered course or cancelled bookings with Nayara.

title: 'Thanks for filthy drinking water': Jaipur residents name potholes after MLAs
content: People in Jaipur are finding creative ways to protest civic problems. Residents of Shiv Vihar Colony put up posters criticizing their MLA, Gopal Sharma, for failing to fix contaminated water issues. Elsewhere, citizens are naming potholes after MLAs in areas like Hawa Mahal and Malviya Nagar. This is a symbolic way to show their disappointment.

title: Harassed for days: UP schoolgirl thrashes accused in public- video
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, a schoolgirl bravely confronted and thrashed a man, Akash, who allegedly harassed her during her daily commute. A viral video captured the girl fearlessly slapping and hitting the accused with a brick. Bystanders intervened, handing Akash over to the police.

title: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recalls public shame after surrogacy
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union faced significant challenges in starting a family. Union recently shared her emotional struggles with Marie Claire, revealing that miscarriages and the subsequent surrogacy journey took a toll on her mental health. She described the experience as feeling like a "f---ing public humiliation" when it didn't go as planned.

title: Who is Ben Askren’s wife? Ex-UFC star’s spouse warns fans of scam accounts
content: Amy Askren, wife of Ben Askren, alerted fans about scam accounts exploiting Ben's recent double lung transplant. These fake profiles were soliciting money under her name, prompting Amy to warn followers on social media. She emphasized that she would never request donations through personal accounts and urged fans to report any imposters, directing them to verified sources for legitimate support.

title: ‘Imposed forcefully’: JDU MP slams SIR in Bihar
content: Janata Dal (United) MP Giridhari Yadav has criticized the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, deeming it rushed and impractical. Opposition parties, including Congress and Samajwadi Party, have protested the SIR, alleging voter suppression and disrupting Parliament. The Election Commission defends the revision as essential for accurate electoral rolls, citing deceased, shifted, and duplicate voters.

title: WBSCTE Result 2025 declared for multiple semester exams; merit list released
content: WBSCT&VE&SD result 2025: The West Bengal State Council of Technical & Vocational Education and Skill Development (WBSCT&VE&SD) has declared the 2025 Higher Secondary (Vocational) examination results. The third phase results, including merit lists and marksheets, are now available on the official website, webscte.co.in. Candidates can check their results by entering the required credentials online. The council has made all relevant result information accessible for download, enabling students to confirm their academic performance and merit status.

title: ‘You were a child’: Nitish loses cool at Tejashwi in Bihar assembly
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar rebuked Tejashwi Yadav, citing RJD's poor governance as the reason for their alliance's dissolution. The exchange occurred amidst opposition protests regarding the Election Commission's voter revision drive, which Tejashwi criticized for its lack of transparency. Concerns have been raised that the exercise could disenfranchise voters, with a significant number of registered voters untraceable.

title: 2 snatch friend from tiger's jaws in MP; spend night in waist-deep river water
content: In a harrowing incident in Satpura Tiger Reserve's core zone, three young men were forced to spend a night in the Denwa river after a tiger attacked them. Venturing into the restricted Madhai range to fish, they were ambushed by the tiger, who initially dragged one of them, Rajendra, into the forest.

title: Mutton politics the flavour, Bihar netas get each other’s goat
content: Bihar's political scene is heating up. Mutton dishes are at the center of controversy during the holy month of Shrawan. Tejashwi Yadav accuses NDA leaders of hypocrisy over meat consumption. He highlights BJP MLAs enjoying mutton during Shrawan. Union Minister Rajiv Ranjan also hosted a mutton party. Prashant Kishor served 'vegetarian biryani'.

title: 'Bhayankar chori': Rahul promises big exposé on poll 'theft'; 'probes LS seat in K'taka'
content: Rahul Gandhi alleges significant poll "theft" after investigating a Lok Sabha seat in Karnataka, promising a detailed exposé with evidence for the Election Commission. He claims similar electoral malpractices occurred in Maharashtra and Bihar, accusing the Election Commission of withholding voter lists and manipulating regulations. The INDIA bloc vows to combat voter disenfranchisement through protests and parliamentary action.

title: Man strangles partner, her daughter in MP; writes message on wall with her lipstick
content: In a tragic incident in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha district, a man allegedly murdered his live-in partner and her three-year-old daughter. Anuj Vishwakarma, the accused, is absconding after the incident in Ganjbasoda. Police discovered a message on the wall suggesting the woman wanted to elope with someone else.

title: 'Daal mein kuch kaala hai’: Rahul targets PM over Trump’s 'ceasefire' claim
content: Rahul Gandhi has directly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his silence on Donald Trump's repeated claims of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. Gandhi questioned Modi's failure to respond to Trump's assertions, highlighting the potential implications for national security.

title: IND vs ENG Test: Kamboj debuts as India make three changes; England win toss yet again
content: England won the toss for the fourth time in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy and chose to field against India at Old Trafford. England leads the series 2-1. Sai Sudharsan replaced Karun Nair, while Anshul Kamboj is making his debut. Gill expressed confusion but acknowledged England's strong performance. Stokes cited favorable bowling conditions and Dawson's inclusion.

title: United States Olympic and Paralympic Committee bans transgender from women's events, citing Donald Trump order
content: Following President Trump's executive order, the USOPC has banned transgender women from competing in women's Olympic and Paralympic events, effective July 2025. Citing the need for fair and safe competition, the policy change aligns with federal mandates and mirrors similar adjustments within the NCAA. This decision arrives as Los Angeles prepares to host the 2028 Summer Olympics.

title: Ghaziabad scam: Man sets up fake embassies of fictional nations
content: In a significant crackdown, Uttar Pradesh STF busted a fake embassy operating from Ghaziabad, arresting Harsh Vardhan Jain. He allegedly posed as a diplomat for fictional nations, using forged documents and fake diplomatic plates on seized vehicles. Authorities recovered Rs 44.7 lakh in cash, foreign currency, counterfeit passports, and forged seals.

title: Pakistan drowning in debt with record $26.7 billion in loans last year
content: Pakistan's reliance on foreign loans surged to $26.7 billion in the last fiscal year, with a significant portion used for debt rollovers rather than project financing. The nation heavily depends on borrowing from multilateral institutions and countries like Saudi Arabia and China to maintain reserves.

title: UP horror: 7 teens sexually assault Dalit boy after he lost Rs 50 bet
content: A sixteen-year-old Dalit boy in Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh, faced sexual assault by seven minors. This happened after he lost a cricket bet. The accused recorded and circulated a video of the assault. They further sexually assaulted him, threatening to release the clip. The police have registered a case under the SC/ST and POCSO Acts.

title: Woman dragged by auto over torn Rs 10 note in Kolkata
content: In Salt Lake, Bratati Mukherjee was injured after an argument with an auto driver, Tapan Das, over a torn Rs 10 note. The driver allegedly dragged her, causing severe injuries. Police arrested Das and he is now in judicial custody. Local residents are worried about increasing auto disputes. They are requesting stricter regulations for auto operations in residential areas.

title: IND vs ENG: Rare! Kamboj becomes first player after India legend to replicate this feat
content: Anshul Kamboj marked his Test debut by emulating Anil Kumble's feat of taking a 10-wicket haul in first-class cricket before his debut. England chose to bat after winning the toss, while India made three changes, including bringing in Kamboj. With England leading the series 2-1, this match is crucial for India to level the series.

title: 'Bumrah gives ammunition to win' - Ex-coach on India's chances in Manchester
content: Former India cricketer and batting coach Sanjay Bangar believes pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah's inclusion significantly boosts India's chances in the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford, where they aim to level the series against England. Bangar emphasises Bumrah's ability to provide the necessary firepower, especially given the expected bowler-friendly conditions.

title: ‘I was very scared’: Child recounts horror of Pitbull attack in Mumbai
content: The minor boy, victim of the dog bite incident that happened on Thursday, said that the accused, Sohail Khan, released the dog towards him when he was sitting with his friends. The child added that when they saw the dog coming towards them, his friends escaped, but he was unable to escape, and eventually the dog bit him. The boy further stated that he was extremely scared during this entire incident.

title: 'Public swimming on streets': Delhi waterlogged with traffic snarls after heavy rain
content: The BJP celebrated the Delhi government's success in preventing waterlogging at Minto Bridge during heavy rain, a location notorious for flooding. Despite the BJP's claims of improvement, the Aam Aadmi Party criticized the government, citing widespread waterlogging in other areas of Delhi. The IMD reported rainfall across the city and forecast continued wet weather, advising residents to take precautions.

title: Odisha teen gang-raped by 3, then sexually assaulted by truck driver who gave her lift
content: In Malkangiri, a 15-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped by three men after being abducted. Later, a truck driver, seeing her distress, offered a lift and sexually assaulted her. Police arrested all four accused, including the truck driver from Madhya Pradesh. The survivor is receiving care at a government-run childcare centre after undergoing a medical examination, according to SP Vinod Patil.

title: Teens Turning To AI For Friendship But Experts Warn Of Mental Health Risk
content: The 15-year-old asks ChatGPT for guidance on back-to-school shopping, makeup colors, low-calorie choices at Smoothie King, plus ideas for her Sweet 16 and her younger sister's birthday party.

title: Rolls-Royce Cars Of Big B, Aamir Khan Fined 38 Lakhs. There's A 'KGF' Twist
content: They say, "What's in a name?" Well, it meant a lot in a bizarre case in Bengaluru when two high-end cars with the names of two Bollywood superstars as owners (only on paper) were fined lakhs of rupees.

title: No Bail, Suspension Of Sentence For 4 Tamil Nadu Cops Convicted In Custodial Death Case
content: In a significant development, the Madurai bench of the Madras High Court rejected petitions for suspension of life sentence and grant of bail filed by four convicted police personnel in the 1999 custodial death of Vincent.

title: Bhandara 'Baron': How UP Man Ran A Fake Embassy In Ghaziabad For 7 Years
content: A swanky two-storey building, four cars with diplomatic number plates parked outside, a name plate that read, "Grand Duchy of Westarctica" and "H E HV Jain Honorary Consul" -- the fake embassy busted in Ghaziabad near Delhi is a perfect example of hi

title: Detonators In A Plastic Bag Found Outside Toilet At Bengaluru Bus Stand
content: Six gelatin sticks, which are the latest form of dynamites, and some detonators, were found in a plastic carry bag near a toilet at a government bus stand in Bengaluru on Wednesday, sparking security concerns.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Air India Crash: We're All Terrified Of Flying Now, Thanks To Conspiracy Theories
content: The erosion of trust has triggered apprehensions among the public about air travel. I know of many erstwhile frequent fliers, who thought nothing before taking a flight for work or leisure, now hesitating before making the next flight booking.

title: Japan's Far Right Sanseito Party Makes Big Gains In Upper House Election
content: Japan's far-right populist Sanseito party was one of the biggest winners in the weekend's upper house election, attracting many voters with its "Japanese First" platform.

title: "Working With UK": India On Air India Crash Families' 'Wrong Bodies' Claim
content: The families of two Air India crash victims in the United Kingdom have alleged that the bodies repatriated to them were misidentified, according to a lawyer representing them.

title: Tirumala Opens New Srivani Darshan Ticket Centre For Devotees To Avoid Long Queues
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) officially opened a new SRIVANI Darshan Ticket Centre. The state-of-the-art facility, strategically located opposite Tirumala Annamayya Bhavan, was inaugurated on Tuesday evening by TTD Chairman B.R. Naidu.

title: Giant Trolls Built From Trash Want To Save Humans From Themselves
content: Nestled in forests around the world, a gentle army of giant wooden trolls want to show humans how to live better without destroying the planet

title: Detained UK Couple In Afghanistan Get Medical Care After UN Appeal
content: An elderly British couple detained for months in Afghanistan are receiving medical care, the Taliban government's top diplomat said Wednesday, after UN experts warned they were at risk of dying.

title: Rana Daggubati Seeks More Time From Probe Agency In Betting App Case, Gets New Date
content: The Enforcement Directorate has given a fresh date of August 11 to actor Rana Daggubati after he failed to appear on Wednesday for questioning in a money laundering case linked to illegal online betting and gambling by certain platforms, official sou

title: Officials Search For Bear That Attacked Female Hiker On Popular Alaska Trail
content: Alaska State Troopers used a helicopter to evacuate the woman off the Basher Trail to a hospital, Anchorage Police spokesperson Christopher Barraza said. Her injuries are considered non-life-threatening, he said.

title: India Has 8.52 Million Tonnes Reserves Of Rare Earth Elements: Minister
content: India has approximately 7.23 million tonnes (MT) of Rare Earth Elements Oxide (REO) contained in 13.15 MT monazite (a mineral of Thorium and Rare Earths) occurring in the coastal beach, teri and red sand and inland alluvium

title: 3 Men Arrested For Raping Children, Holding Hostage In Underground Bunker In US
content: Three men have been arrested for allegedly running a child sex abuse operation inside an underground bunker in Brent, Alabama. The suspects are accused of raping, sodomising, and trafficking six children for more than a year.

title: British F-35's Recovery Reminds Of Daring Rescue Of Mirage 2000 Jet From Mauritius
content: The evacuation of a stranded British F-35B jet from Thiruvananthapuram on Tuesday rekindled memories of a similar problem the Indian Air Force faced two decades ago - one of its Mirage-2000 jets was badly damaged and stuck in Mauritius

title: Ukrainian Forces Test Next-Gen Drones, Catch US Military's Attention: Report
content: Ukrainian frontline units are leading the way in drone warfare, offering useful lessons and new ideas for the US military.

title: Opinion: Blog | 'Backbenchers', Beware Of The Great Seat Shuffle
content: There's a quiet revolution brewing in the classrooms of Chhattisgarh, and no, it's not a surprise test. In a curious move, a government school in the state has decided to eliminate backbenchers by rotating seating arrangements regularly.

title: "Will Boost Indian Tourist Arrivals": Ex Maldives President On PM Modi's Visit
content: Former Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed on Wednesday said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's upcoming visit to the island nation will significantly boost tourism from India and reaffirm bilateral ties.

title: Delhi Court Defers Order On Framing Charge In Railways Hotel Scam Case
content: The Rouse Avenue court on Wednesday deferred the order on framing of charge in the IRCTC hotel scam case. Former Railway Minister Lalu Prasad Yadav, his family members and others are accused in this case.

title: Terps' Locksley: Lost locker room amid pay divide
content: Maryland coach Mike Locksley admitted Tuesday he "lost" the locker room in 2024 over which players to compensate.

title: Ohio State prioritized 3-way QB battle over portal
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day said he didn't add a transfer portal QB this offseason because he wanted to develop the three passers the Buckeyes have on campus.

title: Venus, 45, wins in D.C.; oldest since Navratilova
content: Venus Williams became the second-oldest woman to win a tour-level singles match in professional tennis at age 45, beating Peyton Stearns -- 22 years her junior -- by a 6-3, 6-4 score at the DC Open.

title: 'Rock bottom': Dodgers bullpen implodes again
content: The Dodgers have long been expected to target bullpen help ahead of the trade deadline, which is now eight days away, but the urgency has ratcheted up after another bullpen implosion.

title: Raiders reunite ex-Pro Bowler Adams with Carroll
content: The Raiders signed three-time Pro Bowl safety Jamal Adams, reuniting him with coach Pete Carroll, whom he played under in Seattle.

title: Smart credits Doncic with assist for Lakers move
content: Marcus Smart credited Luka Doncic for recruiting him to Los Angeles at his introductory news conference with the Lakers on Tuesday.

title: Sources: Saints eye Blackmon to replace Mathieu
content: Following Tyrann Mathieu's retirement, the Saints are working to sign Julian Blackmon, one of the top safeties available, sources told ESPN.

title: Holliday rate: Rox give record bonus to star's son
content: The Rockies have signed fourth overall pick Ethan Holliday to a $9 million bonus, the richest ever given to a high school player.

title: 😬 NBA's biggest roster mistakes since 2020
content: Zach Kram examines the deals, trades and picks that all 30 NBA teams would like to take back from the 2020s.

title: Passan's ultimate MLB trade deadline preview: Where all 30 teams stand, best fits and latest intel
content: From the contenders to the rebuilders, here's what every front office is thinking ahead of the July 31 deadline.

title: We ranked the 50 most impactful NFL offseason moves, from Davante Adams to Russell Wilson
content: Which offseason acquisitions and draft picks will have the most impact at their new destinations in Year 1? Matt Bowen ranks the top 50.

title: Randle-Towns trade, Bridges to New York and more: Regrading 2024 offseason moves
content: NBA expert Kevin Pelton looks back at 10 of the biggest trade and free agency moves and regrades them.

title: 14 teams and loads of questions they must answer to win the 2025 CFP crown
content: The fewer things that must go right, the better a team's chances. Here's what has to fall each contender's way.

title: England's late show stuns Italy as super-subs seal final spot
content: England's super-subs saved the day with minutes to go against Italy as the Lionesses snuck into the Euro 2025 final.

title: Power Rankings: Can Lynx sustain? Biggest second-half question for every team
content: Can New York catch Minnesota? How much will Caitlin Clark play? Here are the challenges facing each team.

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: Most of the NHL free agent deals are handed out July 1. But there are still some players left -- here are the top remaining unrestricted free agents.

title: Scheffler's dominance, players to watch and how the Ryder Cup teams look
content: What's next for Scottie Scheffler? Who are the locks for Bethpage, and who has work to do? Following The Open, we look ahead to the rest of the 2025 golf season.

title: Betting buzz: Dallas Cowboys' season win total lowest since 2003
content: The Cowboys' win total for this season has dropped to 7.5 at ESPN BET, the lowest preseason win total for a Cowboys team since 2003.

title: Replacing Bellingham: How will Real Madrid cope without star midfielder?
content: Jude Bellingham is out for 12 weeks with a shoulder injury, so which Real Madrid players will have to step up in his absence?

title: Will Ekitike be a Liverpool hit or flop? Why he's so hard to scout
content: Hugo Ekitike is everything "dumb" clubs get wrong about transfers, and everything smart clubs get right.

title: Numbers you need to know as you prep for draft day
content: Make of them what you will, but here are the stats from last season that you should be aware of as you prepare for your drafts.

title: Petitti letter: Michigan sign-stealing penalties have gone far enough
content: Despite charges of serious NCAA rule violations, commissioner indicates sanctions have run their course

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including the CP3-Clippers reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Spain finally have all of Barcelona's midfield stars in top form together
content: Alexia Putellas, Aitana Bonmatí and Patri Guijarro have been unable to combine for Spain as they do for Barcelona. At Euro 2025, that is changing.

title: Berger typifies Germany's fight as tough semifinal looms
content: Germany needed their goalkeeper at her best vs. France and will need her again to star again to beat Spain.

title: Source: Mbappé to take No. 10 jersey at Madrid
content: Kylian Mbappé will wear the No. 10 jersey at Real Madrid next season, switching from the No. 9 he wore last year, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: MLS All-Star coach hopeful missing Messi plays
content: The 2025 MLS All-Star Game in Austin, Texas, was supposed to be the first featuring Lionel Messi after injury kept him out of the 2024 event. That appeared less likely following Monday's first training session.

title: Wiegman: England run to Euro final like a 'movie'
content: England manager Sarina Wiegman said her team's run at Euro 2025 is like a movie after they scored another dramatic win over Italy in the semifinals.

title: De Gea: Madrid move collapsed 'for a reason'
content: Former Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea has said he will only reveal details of his failed move to Real Madrid once his career is over.

title: Italy 'hurt' after falling 1 minute short of dream
content: Italy coach Andrea Soncin found solace in heartbreak after his side came within one minute of reaching the Euro 2025 final, saying it was an encouraging sign that they came so close before losing 2-1 to England in extra time on Tuesday.

title: Sources: Chelsea eyeing Garnacho; Utd drop value
content: Any potential Alejandro Garnacho transfer from Man United to Chelsea would depend on players first departing Stamford Bridge, sources have told ESPN.

title: Arteta: Nine teams could win Premier League title
content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta said he believes his side have the "right ingredients" to end their 21-year Premier League title hiatus.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Spurs enter Rodrygo race
content: Liverpool and Spurs have joined Bayern, Arsenal and Chelsea in monitoring Rodrygo's situation. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Pacquiao back in welterweight top 10; Usyk retains heavyweight top spot
content: Manny Pacquiao reclaims a spot in the welterweight rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: National highways construction pace slows to 29km/day in FY25: Gadkari
content: “All the NHs development projects, including development of access-controlled High Speed Corridors (HSC)/Expressways, are planned in line with PM GatiShakti National Master Plan (NMP) Principles,” Minister Nitin Gadkari said

title: Army troops rescue two injured in road accident in remote Ladakh
content: "One civil car with two occupants met with an accident near the Pang area of Ladakh. The passengers were injured as their vehicle overturned after skidding off the road," the Fire and Fury Corps said in a post

title: Supreme Court issues notice to Centre, Madhya Pradesh on plea against 237 ‘illegal’ environmental clearances by SEIAA member-secretary
content: The petition alleged the clearances were results of a deliberate strategy to bypass the collective decision-making process mandated by the law, and exploited the ‘deemed approval’ provisions after letting statutory periods lapse

title: Nearly 27,000 people died in road accidents on National Highway during first six months in 2025: Gadkari
content: In a written reply to the Rajya Sabha,  Union Minister Nitin Gadkari says road safety audit has been conducted for 1,12,561 km national highways during last the three years.

title: Congress flags 'serious questions' over impact of India-U.K. FTA on domestic industry
content: The Opposition party's attack came after Prime Minister Modi on Wednesday left on a four-day visit to the U.K. and the Maldives

title: Entire bullet train project from Maharashtra to Sabarmati expected to be ready by 2029: Vaishnaw
content: “The Gujarat portion of the corridor between Vapi and Sabarmati is planned to be completed by December 2027, and the entire project by December 2029,” the Union Minister said in a written reply

title: Karnataka gets 750 electric buses under PM-eBus Sewa scheme, but asks Centre for direct funding to State-run transport corporation
content: Launched on August 16, 2023, the PM-eBus Sewa scheme aims to strengthen public transport systems by deploying 10,000 electric buses across India through a PPP model

title: Andhra Pradesh will be the best bet for investors from UAE, CM Chandrababu Naidu gives assurance
content: “I invite you to spend 25% of your time in our State and see our functioning. If you are not confident of our ability to deliver on our promises, you can leave us,” CM Chandrababu Naidu told Abdulla Bin Touq Al Marri

title: Parliament Monsoon Session: Opposition demands two-day discussion on Pahalgam, Operation Sindoor in Rajya Sabha
content: Congress leader Pramod Tiwari said the Opposition wanted no resolution brought up during the debate on Operation Sindoor/Pahalgam attack and a normal discussion spanning two days should be held

title: VS Achuthanandan funeral LIVE updates: Former Kerala CM to be cremated with full State honours
content: Funeral of revered communist leader and former Kerala CM V.S. Achuthanandan is set to be held with full State honours at Punnapra-Vayalar Martyrs’ Memorial at Valiya Chudukkad in Alappuzha district

title: Clay Ganesha idols take shape at Visakhapatnam’s Sankalpa Art Village
content: At Sankalpa Art Village, artisans from Bengal craft Ganesh idols using traditional methods and natural materials, offering a quiet shift toward sustainable celebration

title: A guide to Gingee fort, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site
content: After being declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site, Gingee fort has been seeing a surge in visitors. We scale it as we brush upon its history

title: Hindi speakers’ society of West Bengal to celebrate 100 years of Premchand’s masterpiece Rangbhoomi in Kolkata
content: At a time when it has become almost routine for language fanatics to make news, the West Bengal Hindi Speakers’ Society is holding a seminar to revisit the Hindi novel that was published a century ago

title: Ensure Perambalur village temple car passes through streets with Scheduled Caste residents: Madras High Court
content: Justice P. Velmurugan quashes Revenue Divisional Officer’s peace committee proceedings, in which signatures of a few Scheduled Caste residents had been obtained

title: Second Socio-Economic and Educational survey by Karnataka Backward Classes Commission to begin on September 22
content: The second survey comes after the government’s decision to keep aside the first survey conducted in 2015 by the commission headed by H. Kantharaj, the report of which was submitted in 2024

title: Polls being 'stolen'; will bring out 'vote theft' in black and white with Karnataka example: Rahul
content: Rahul Gandhi said he would put before the people and the Election Commission in black in white on how the "theft of votes" is being done

title: PM Modi embarks on four-day visit to U.K., Maldives
content: In his departure statement, Mr. Modi said India and the United Kingdom share a comprehensive strategic partnership that has witnessed significant progress in recent years

title: 24 students hospitalised after consuming mid-day meal in Belagavi school
content: While several of them were treated at nearby private hospitals, a few were shifted to the district hospital after they complained of severe uneasiness

title: Presidential reference | When have Presidents invoked this and what has Supreme Court opined?
content: Since 1951, Presidents have sought clarity from the Supreme Court on sixteen occasions. At times, the apex court has declined to comment

title: Punnapra-Vayalar — The blood-red uprising that shaped Kerala’s Left | Explained
content: The movement, which played a critical role in shaping Kerala’s political landscape, was the crucible that forged V.S. Achuthanandan’s lifelong commitment to justice and resistance

title: Homecoming of a hero: CPI(M) leader V.S. Achuthanandan’s last journey draws thousands
content: The cortege took more than 22 hours to cover a distance of around 150 km from Thiruvananthapuram to Paravur

title: Several schools in Himachal receive hoax bomb threats
content: As the news broke, frantic parents called schools to enquire about the safety of their children and rushed to pick them up. In some schools, students were shifted to safe places.

title: Peddireddi Ramachandra Reddy vows befitting reply to NDA over arrests of party leaders if YSRCP voted to power next term
content: Peddireddi Ramachandra Reddy, former Home Minister T. Vanita and former MP M. Bharat interacted with P.V. Midhun Reddy during mulaqat in Rajahmundry Central Prison

title: T.N. CM Stalin continues to review ‘Ungaludan Stalin’ programme from hospital
content: Mr. Stalin had a virtual session with the Collectors of Coimbatore, Kancheepuram, and Kanniyakumari districts and reviewed the programme’s implementation in those districts.

title: Three booked in Kerala’s Kasaragod for ‘hate campaign’ against V.S. Achuthanandan on social media
content: Police said the accused deliberately disseminated defamatory content aimed at insulting Achuthanandan

title: Supreme Court asks YouTube channel to first approach High Court in ‘Dharmasthala burials’ case
content: The petition had sought an interim stay of the civil court order of July 18, which had also directed the media to take down any content already published in connection with the issue.

title: How Karnataka’s artisans strive to stay afloat sans a middleman
content: In the glow of minimalist lamps and aesthetic reels, the voices of those who shape India’s craft legacy grow faint — struggling to stay relevant in an ever-shifting market

title: Venkatapuram in Telangana’s Mulugu records 46 cm rainfall in 28 hours, authorities launch full-scale emergency response
content: People have been advised to contact the district toll-free number 18004257109 for emergency support, suggestions, or clarifications

title: Radio Charminar completes a decade in Hyderabad
content: With ‘Dil Se Hyderabadi’ as its tagline, the community radio station educates and entertains to bring diverse voices to the fore

title: Ilaiyaraaja’s name removed from all promotional materials of ‘Mrs. and Mr.’ movie: Vanitha Film Productions tells Madras High Court
content: The composer had sought to restrain the production house from exploiting his personality rights for the promotion of its movie ‘Mrs. and Mr.’

title: U.P. STF busts fake embassy in Ghaziabad, man running 'West Arctica' consulate held
content: According to the STF's Noida unit, preliminary investigations suggest that Jain was engaged in brokering deals by falsely promising job placements for companies and individuals in foreign countries.

title: Dharmasthala burial case: 20 police personnel posted in SIT
content: The order draws the curtains on rumours about M.N. Anucheth and Soumyalatha excusing themselves from the probe citing personal reasons

title: U.S. trade deals with Japan, Indonesia hold lessons, warnings for India: experts
content: “India is of course monitoring all the deals that are being struck with the U.S., but it’s also important to remember that these are deals so far in words and have not been officially signed yet,” according to a source

title: INDIA bloc MPs protest in Parliament complex against SIR exercise in Bihar
content: Many of leaders in the Opposition were seen wearing black clothes and carrying placards against the SIR in Bihar

title: Private schools in Agra, Meerut receive bomb threat emails
content: Preliminary findings indicate that these emails originated from Kolkata, says ACP Bhosale, adding that a more in-depth investigation was underway to trace the culprits

title: India extends airspace closure for Pakistan planes till August 24
content: The ban is part of various measures taken by the government against Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Submit emergency quota request at least a day before train departure: Railway ministry
content: The ministry has clarified that the requests received on the same day of the scheduled departure of a train will not be entertained.

title: Home Minister Amit Shah meets PM Modi in Parliament office
content: The meeting comes against the backdrop of the surprise resignation of Jagdeep Dhankhar as Vice President on July 21

title: V-P Dhankhar’s resignation: Mallikarjun Kharge says ‘daal mein kuch kaala hai’, seeks govt. clarification
content: The government must answer why he resigned, what are the reasons, what is the secret behind it. We feel that ‘daal mein kuch kaala hai ‘(there is something fishy), says Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge

title: Work from home advise from Cyberabad police on second consecutive day, rain disrupts Wednesday morning traffic
content: People choosing four-wheelers in the rain led to higher vehicular traffic, said Cyberabad Traffic Police official

title: Bihar Assembly adjourned till 2 p.m. amid ruckus, Tejashwi-Nitish spat over Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls
content: Only three days of this session are left. You should say whatever you wish during elections, says Chief Minister Nitish Kumar

title: Visually challenged minor girl murder: Life sentence for accused in Andhra Pradesh
content: As per the prosecution, the accused attacked the minor girl with a knife owing to a grudge after she rejected his demand to satisfy his sexual desire

title: 23-year-old Indian student brutally assaulted in Australia’s Adelaide; suffers brain trauma, facial fracture
content: A group of men approached Charanpreet Singh and attacked him over a car parking dispute; police arrested a 20-year-old Enfield man for assault and others fled and remain unidentified

title: Supreme Court directs woman IPS officer to tender unconditional apology to estranged husband, his family
content: A Bench comprising Chief Justice B.R. Gavai and Justice Augustine George Masih further directed the woman IPS officer and her parents to tender an unconditional apology to the family of the estranged husband

title: Parliament Monsoon Session: Deadlock continues in Parliament as both Houses see no business for third straight day
content: In both Houses, Opposition members protested demanding a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar by the Election Commission of India

title: Eyeing aspiring farmers, agriculture university in Bengaluru to launch paid consultancy service
content: The university’s experts will provide cropping plan based on requirements, nature of land and availability of labour, besides site visit

title: Manipur theatre personality Ratan Thiyam passes away
content: Ratan Thiyam was one of the pioneers of the Theatre of Roots movement that blended ancient Indian theatrical traditions with modern themes

title: Trump reaches silver jubilee of India-Pakistan ceasefire claim, PM totally quiet: Congress
content: He has trumpeted 25 times in the last 73 days but the Prime Minister of India is totally quiet - finding time only to travel abroad and to destabilise democratic institutions at home, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Justice Tarlok Singh Chauhan sworn in as Chief Justice of Jharkhand High Court
content: The name of Justice Chauhan, the second senior-most judge of the Himachal Pradesh High Court, was recommended by the Supreme Court Collegium on May 26

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 3 highlights: Continuing deadlock causes both Houses to adjourn for the day
content: Another day of no business in Parliament as Opposition protests over Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar continue to stall proceedings

title: Mortal remains of Kerala trainee pilot killed in Canada to be flown to Kochi July 26
content: 23-year-old was killed after his flight collided with another during a practice session in Manitoba province in Canada on July 8

title: War room set up to monitor dengue cases in Yadgir in Karnataka
content: An official said that this is a routine process that the department takes up every year between June and September

title: Pakistan steeped in fanaticism, terrorism: India tells UNSC meeting
content: India calls for zero tolerance for terrorism, criticises Pakistan’s support for cross-border terrorism at U.N. Security Council meeting

title: Mortal remains of V.S. Achuthanandan reach Alappuzha
content: The funeral of Achuthanandan will be held with full State honours at Punnapra-Vayalar Martyrs’ Memorial at Valiya Chudukkad

title: Redeeming India’s nuclear power promise
content: If India is to meet its ambitious target of 100 GW of power generating capacity by 2047, it needs foreign partners as well as private entities to participate in the nuclear sector which has been till now completely under the government

title: How different constitutional drafts imagined India
content: Between 1895 and 1948, various constitutional drafts were proposed reflecting contrasting ideologies — from early liberalism to Gandhian decentralism to radical socialism

title: Boys continue to outnumber girls in private schools in India | Data
content: In the northern and western States, the share of girls enrolled in any school is lower than India’s average of 48.1%

title: Polyandry part of ancient tribal tradition, says Himachal Ministers after woman marries two men
content: Revenue laws of Himachal Pradesh recognise this tradition, which is named “Jodidara”. The tradition is also recognised under sections 494 and 495 of the Indian Penal Code

title: Multiple stories of humiliation of Devadasi children
content: The need for naming the father has become a problem, especially after the application process has been moved online

title: Karnataka proposes a new Devadasi legislation with clauses on paternity test, right to property
content: Inter-departmental consultation is almost complete on the proposed law and could soon be brought before the Cabinet

title: Indian man injured in ‘racist’ attack in Ireland’s Dublin
content: Indian Ambassador to Ireland Akhilesh Mishra was among those taking to social media to express his shock over the attack and also questioned some of the Irish media coverage of the violent assault

title: T.N. Language Atlas: 96 languages spoken in State as per 2011 Census
content: In the Language Atlas, the term ‘speakers’ referred only to individuals who reported a particular language as their mother tongue during the Census enumeration

title: A bitter episode in the DMK-Congress relationship in Tamil Nadu during 1971 polls
content: In 1971, the two parties had come together for the first time to face the polls when the Lok Sabha and Assembly elections were held simultaneously

title: Advanced street cameras, toll plaza alerts: How Patna murder accused were nabbed in Kolkata
content: Bihar-based gangster Chandan Mishra was out on parole and was shot dead in an open firing inside Paras Hospital in Patna in the morning on July 17. The ‘leader’ of the hit team and three others were arrested in Kolkata on July 18 in joint operations of the Bihar Police, West Bengal Police, and Kolkata Police

title: Sheva Koliwada women’s group to launch indefinite JNPA channel blockade from August 15 over long-standing rehabilitation issues
content: In 1984, an entire village in Maharashtra gave up their homes and land for the development of a major port in Navi Mumbai. Four decades later, the displaced families continue to live in temporary shelters, battling neglect and unsanitary living conditions

title: Rajasthan Governor lays emphasis on social concerns in health management
content: Haribhau Bagade said the institutions should pay attention to research for improving health care services

title: Quality concerns continue to haunt Polavaram project, despite foreign experts’ recommendations
content: Manual and guidelines relating to quality control are yet to be published; draft manual prepared by AFRI awaits approval from several Central, State agencies

title: MP Kesineni Sivanath urges Railway Board to expedite projects in Vijayawada Division
content: Saying that despite 550 schools meeting eligibility criteria for PM Shri schools in NTR district only 27 schools sanctioned, the MP urges the Centre to reconsider allocation

title: A.P. CM orders satellite survey for crop mapping to ensure better income of farmers
content: Naidu insists on crop health monitoring in real time; officials told to cross-verify satellite data with field inputs and guide farmers to cultivate crops in clusters

title: Reforms or regression?
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu will have to balance industrial development with labour rights

title: Telangana High Court dismisses welfare association’s plea over 300 square yards at Kowkur
content: The dispute began when the adjacent landowner started building a compound wall, prompting the villa association to object

title: ‘Remedial education must be a sustained component in schooling system’
content: Telangana Education Commission chairman said the consultation was important, in the wake of poor comprehension levels and foundational learning crisis

title: August 15 set as deadline to complete survey to acquire land for Kochi Bypass
content: Surveyors, posted in 18 villages through which the proposed 44.70-km-long greenfield highway will pass, are in the process of consolidating data like survey numbers and the precise extent of plots that ought to be acquired

title: GI tag sought for Kancheepuram idli
content: Unlike the smooth and fluffy South Indian idli, the Kancheepuram idli is made using coarsely ground parboiled rice and black gram (urad dal), which gives it a dense and grainy texture

title: MMA divisional rankings: With Dustin Poirier retired, who gets his top-10 spot at lightweight?

title: 'It's a toothache': Untold stories of NFL camp holdouts from players, agents, teams
content: future Hall of Fame offensive tackle Walter Jones spotted something in a newspaper that changed everything about his holdout in 2002 . he extended his absence into the first two games of the regular season . the amount of money he had forfeited meant two checks totaling $578,823 had not been deposited into Jones' bank account .
